critique: This is an executive order from 1941 exempting a Federal Communications Commission employee from mandatory retirement for one year. Given the historical context, it's unlikely to have a strong ideological tilt. It seems to be a fairly routine administrative action. There's no indication of immigration policy, civil liberties concerns, or social inclusion issues. It does give the executive branch more power, but only in a very limited way. It doesn't seem to have much impact on federalism or economic regulation.
